question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Find $76-(-4\cdot8-2)+13.$
ground_truth: Recall that expressions within parentheses should be calculated first. So \begin{align*} 76-(-4\cdot8-2)+13 &=76-(-34)+13.\end{align*}Remember that subtracting a negative number is the same as adding a positive number. So \begin{align*} 76-(-34)+13 &=76+34+13\\ &=110+13=\boxed{123}.\end{align*}

question:
$$76-(-4\cdot8-2)+13$$
$$=76-(-32-2)+13$$
$$=76+34+13$$
$$=103+13$$
$$=116$$
Final Answer: \boxed{$116$}. I hope it is correct.
